meanings.definition: The state or quality of being excessively long or wordy in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: Her prolixity in explaining the simple task made everyone lose interest.
meanings.sent2: The professor's prolixity in lectures often put students to sleep.
meanings.sent3: Despite his prolixity, he managed to convey the message effectively.
meanings.sent4: The prolixity of the legal document made it challenging to decipher.
meanings.sent5: The prolixity of the novel made it difficult to finish reading.

meanings.definition: A long-winded or verbose style of communication.
meanings.sent1: The politician's prolixity during the speech bored the audience.
meanings.sent2: Her prolixity in emails often led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: His prolixity in storytelling made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The prolixity of the advertisement failed to capture attention.
meanings.sent5: The prolixity of the presentation made it hard to follow.
